data.title: Extended support for server 2003
data.meta_description:
Hi,  
I have few application servers which are still running on server 2003 unfortunately.  
I want to know if Microsoft is still providing support and updates through ESU channel for server 2003 also just like windows 7 and server 2008.  
especially ifâ¦
data.text:
Hi @WinTechie ,

As Dave mentioned, there's no support available for Windows Server 2003 anymore.

Microsoft did release hotfixes for the WannaCry / Petya vulnerabilities:

https://msrc-blog.microsoft.com/2017/05/12/customer-guidance-for-wannacrypt-attacks/

https://www.microsoft.com/security/blog/2017/06/27/new-ransomware-old-techniques-petya-adds-worm-capabilities

As your application servers are no longer supported and at high risk for vulnerabilities, I would highly advise to keep them in a as closed environment as possible to lesser the chance of vulnerability risk.

----------

(If the reply was helpful please don't forget to upvote and/or accept as answer, thank you)

Best regards,

Leon

Hi,

Thank you for posting in our forum.

As the two MVPs said, the 2003 version is too old and Windows Server 2003 no longer supports it.

Hope this information can help you

Best wishes

Vicky
